info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 12 at 6:52AM CDT until June 12 at 7:30AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN WHEELER AND NORTHERN COLLINGSWORTH COUNTIES... At 651 AM CDT, two severe thunderstorms, the first located near Twitty and the second 6 miles west of Lela, were moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Shamrock, Dozier, Lutie, Lela, Samnorwood and Twitty. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
